Select nextval('T_WAGE_FLOW_SEQ') From dual
insert into T_WAGE_FLOW(id,app_id,type,n0_amount,n1_amount,n2_amount,n3_amount,n4_amount,n5_amount,n0_check,n1_check,n2_check,n3_check,n4_check,n5_check,rest_amount,avg_amount,state,operator,org_id,create_time,update_time) values( #{id, jdbcType=INTEGER},#{appId, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{type, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{n0Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},#{n1Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},#{n2Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},#{n3Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},#{n4Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},#{n5Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},#{n0Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{n1Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{n2Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{n3Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{n4Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{n5Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{restAmount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},#{avgAmount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},#{state, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{operator, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{orgId, jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{createTime, jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},#{updateTime, jdbcType=TIMESTAMP})

update T_WAGE_FLOW set
app_id = #{appId, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
type = #{type, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
n0_amount = #{n0Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},
n1_amount = #{n1Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},
n2_amount = #{n2Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},
n3_amount = #{n3Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},
n4_amount = #{n4Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},
n5_amount = #{n5Amount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},
n0_check = #{n0Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
n1_check = #{n1Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
n2_check = #{n2Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
n3_check = #{n3Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
n4_check = #{n4Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
n5_check = #{n5Check, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
rest_amount = #{restAmount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},
avg_amount = #{avgAmount, jdbcType=DOUBLE},
state = #{state, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
operator = #{operator, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
org_id = #{orgId, jdbcType=VARCHAR},
create_time = #{createTime, jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
update_time = #{updateTime, jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where id = #{id}
